name: Carrot Green Beans Poriyal
description: Carrot Green Beans Poriyal. Easy Green Beans Carrot Coconut stir fry side. South Indian Green Beans Coconut Poriyal Recipe. Vegan Gluten-free Soy-free Indian Side.. Serves 2
recipeIngredient: 1/2 tsp urad dal (split black gram optional)
2  dried red chilies (broken (use hot chilies like cayenne or birds eye or mild like California red))
a pinch of asafetida (hing - omit to make gluten-free)
2 to 2.5 cups chopped green beans (string beans or french beans (haricots verts) chopped into 1/2 to 3/4 inch bite size))
1 cup chopped carrots or baby carrots
2 to 3 tbsp coconut shreds (dried or frozen(fresh))

recipeInstructions.text: Heat oil in a skillet over medium heat. When hot add mustard seeds and let them start to pop.
recipeInstructions.name: Heat oil in a skillet over medium heat. When hot add mustard seeds and let them start to pop.

recipeInstructions.text: Reduce heat to medium low, add urad dal and cook until dal changes color. 15 to 30 seconds.
recipeInstructions.name: Reduce heat to medium low, add urad dal and cook until dal changes color. 15 to 30 seconds.

recipeInstructions.text: Add chilies, asafetida and curry leaves carefully. Mix and cook for 10 seconds.
recipeInstructions.name: Add chilies, asafetida and curry leaves carefully. Mix and cook for 10 seconds.

recipeInstructions.text: Add green beans, carrots, mix well. Add water, mix, cover and cook for 12 minutes.
recipeInstructions.name: Add green beans, carrots, mix well. Add water, mix, cover and cook for 12 minutes.

recipeInstructions.text: Add salt, coconut and a tbsp or so water if needed, and mix in. Cover and cook until the beans are done to preference. 5 to 10 minutes. Taste and adjust salt and spice. Add cayenne if needed. Serve hot with Dals, lentil soups and flatbread or Dosa.
